article.headline: Harvard 85, Colgate 82 (OT)
article.story: HAMILTON, N.Y. (AP) -- Dave Giovacchini scored a career-high 20 points, including 10 in overtime, to lead Harvard to an 85-82 win over Colgate Friday in a non-conference game. Harvard (2-5) snaps a three-game losing streak, while Colgate (2-5) drops its third straight game. Other Harvard players in double figures were Matt Stehle and Kevin Rogus with 15 each, Brian Cusworth with 14 and Jason Norman with 11 points. Stehle finished with 11 rebounds, while Cusworth grabbed 10. Jon Simon led Colgate with 20 points, while Kyle Roemer had a career-high 19, Alvin Reed added 17 and Andrew Zidar 15. Colgate's leading rebounder was Zidar with nine. Colgate sent the game into overtime on Simon's 3-pointer with 7 1/2 seconds remaining. With the score tied 71-71 in overtime, Harvard took control with a five-point run. Colgate had one last chance to tie the game trailing 84-82 with 15 seconds left, but turned the ball over before getting a shot off.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
